content.title: Data in SUSTAINABLE ENERGY
content.cta: Scroll, tab or use your keyboard to move ahead

content.text: This module provides an in-depth introduction to the role of energy data in planning, monitoring, and evaluation (PM&E) for sustainable energy development. It highlights how reliable, up-to-date, and ethically sourced data underpin evidence-based decision-making, policy formulation, and the monitoring of progress toward Sustainable Development Goal 7 (SDG7)—ensuring affordable, reliable, sustainable, and modern energy for all by 2030. Participants will explore the importance of standardized frameworks for data reporting, key performance indicators (KPIs), and common PM&E principles, as well as challenges such as data accessibility, quality, and ethical considerations in developing contexts. Additionally, the module introduces innovative tools, techniques, and trends—such as data science applications, energy modeling, and artificial intelligence—and their relevance for energy systems transformation. Designed for UNDP Country Offices and policymakers, the module equips participants with the foundational knowledge to leverage energy data for impactful, equitable, and sustainable outcomes.

content.title: Learning Objectives
content.intro: of MODULE 7 on DATA IN SUSTAINABLE ENERGY

objectives.title: Identify how reliable and ethically sourced data informs evidence-based decision-making, supports sustainable energy policies, and advances equity and inclusivity in energy access.

Apply principles of strategic energy planning, monitoring, and evaluation to develop effective frameworks and quantifiable indicators for energy projects and policies, incorporating gender and intersectional perspectives.

Examine key data science techniques, energy modeling tools, and visualization methods, focusing on their relevance, potential applications, and considerations for their use in energy planning and decision-making, particularly in the context of developing countries.

Recognize emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and smart grids, and assess their potential to optimize energy systems, enhance equity, and drive innovation in the energy sector.
